intro: Genosiris inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal genosiris, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant features erect, branched stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically displaying shades of pink or purple. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
